svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Vertical axis shows average self-reported life satisfaction scores in the Cantril Ladder. Horizontal axis shows share
of people who say they are 'very happy' or 'rather happy' (as opposed to 'not very happy' or 'not at all happy')
Share of people who say they are 'very happy' or 'rather happy' (WVS)
Self-reported life satisfaction (average Cantril Ladder score)
Source: World Value Survey (2014), World Happiness Report (2017)
Note: Cantril ladder question: “Please imagine a ladder, with steps numbered from 0 at the bottom to 10 at the top. The top of theladder
represents the best possible life for you and the bottom of the ladder represents the worst possible life for you. On which step ofthe ladder would
you say you personally feel you stand at this time?” World Value Survey question: "Taking all things together, would you say you are (i) Very
happy, (ii) Rather happy, (iii) Not very happy or (iv) Not at all happy".
